intro: Tithymalus huanchahanus, commonly known as the Huancahua, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in the cool, dry climates of the Andes. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to conserve moisture in arid conditions. Tithymalus huanchahanus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional Andean medicine.
